job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Kootenai's IT staff is very competent, loyal, and knowledgeable.
cons: Leadership is asleep at the wheel. Perhaps not even in the wheelhouse. Leadership has made some pretty poor decisions financially during the pandemic and Epic EMR implementation. Now they are in the process of trimming staff and replacing IT departments with outsourced managed IT service companies. This directly contradicts their Mission Statement “To provide locally supported, leading-edge technology and excellent customer service.” They have done this in the past, and again it will come back to bite them. Their once thriving and award-winning IT departments are suffering and understaffed. Sad to see it head downhill.

review_title: Overall a good place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse%2C BSN in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros:
The hospital is good at keeping staff informed of changes and updates. Nice new cafeteria with fresh made to order food, gourmet coffee stand. Cafeteria, coffee stand, gift shop will allow automatic payments from paycheck so you don't have to carry cash or debit card with you. 

Feels like close knit group, management is visible and willing to talk if you have questions. HR onsite and they haven't outsourced any departments (yet) like hospitals in Spokane.
cons: Seems like you have to know someone to get promoted or transferred to new departments. At times, can be cliquey. Health insurance for family is expensive. Some units dont seem to allow for adequate training for newer nurses. Can feel a little like you have been thrown to the wolves.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kootenai, ID
pros: Benefits are pretty good
cons: You are not s person, just a number. Management is degrading to employees.  Its all about profit. We only get a 2% raise and never a cost of living. Pay is low.  Drs are understaffed and see too many patients. They are rushed and push people through like cattle. In the business office they have smashed almost 200 people in small cubicles.  They treat these people like lowlife animals. Only one small breakroom with  a few tables. Most people eat at their desk and do not take a lunch break.  Their is little room for advancement and the company does not work to help anyone advance. They are not " for family".  Employees are a dime a dozen and treated as such.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Benefits are okay n other departments are sort of friendly
cons: The pay isn’t enough for someone who works there butt off everyday, willing to volunteer to help others, willing to come into work on days off, coming into work on time n getting the rooms thoroughly an still never got the respect from management n sups. Following the policy as neeeded but few people get away with it, slacks off an gets there days they want n pays more then curtain people. Employees should be following all rules n policy for Kootenai Hospital an people are getting away with murder. Taking 1-3 hr breaks leaving from work for hr on break time, an walking around doing nothing looking on there phones. There’s no team work, no communication an lack of respecting. This is by all housekeeping department. The management an sups don’t seem to care for the houskeepers people who works hard n they let others slack off. This hospotial is horriable place to work...I regret it everyday!

job_title: in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: I have worked at Kootenai for 18 years and love it here. Although I have seen many changes, most have been for the good of the employees and the patients that the hospital serves. Kootenai offers fully paid medical/dental and vision insurance at no cost to a full time employee and only $30 per month for part time employees. They have a great wellness program with discounts to local gym's. Kootenai also pays a fair wage for the size and community in which they serve. Overall, I would recommend Kootenai to anyone that wanted a stable and fulfilling job.
cons: Cannot think of any at this time.

cons: Everything else...
